content.rendered:
A pair of pared down projects sandwich a highly ornamental one with work from New York, Salt Lake City, and Berlin.

Utility Garments by STUDIO NEWWORK

Utility Garments is a clothing line from Japanese fashion brand Markaware that sells practical, unadorned t-shirts, shirts, denim, knitwear, and outerwear — utilitarian pieces, basically. I don’t expect this project to get a high percentage of “Great” votes as it’s far from a classically exciting Friday Like but, as designed by New York, NY-based STUDIO NEWWORK, the almost absurdly minimalist design is handled exceptionally well and, more importantly, it fits the product. The condensed logo works surprisingly good at any size, from XS to XXL, and holds up quite well when reproduced on fabric. This verges on the VICE/hipster aesthetic that might have a few of you rolling your eyes — and that’s fine — but to be able to convey an attitude with minimal elements, as this does, is not an easy task. See full project

Tom’s Town Distilling Co. by Kevin Cantrell

Tom’s Town Distilling Co. is the first legal distillery in Kansas City since Prohibition and knowingly channels the 1920s vibe and aesthetics of The Great Gatsby. Salt Lake City, UT-based Kevin Cantrell does his best The Great Gatsby-Leonardo-DiCaprio-movie-poster impersonation and then some with a full-on onslaught of Art Deco patterns and typography, all extravagantly gold foiled or gold embossed or gold emblazoned in some way. The image above shows only the identity elements and at the link there are a series of bottle and label designs that are out of control cool. See full project

ESO by Malwin Béla Hürkey

ESO (European Southern Observatory) is the European organization for astronomical research in the Southern hemisphere with a stunning new set of materials by Berlin-based Malwin Béla Hürkey. With less than fifty shades of gray, the minimal identity looks, smells, and tastes like science with a touch of 2001: A Space Odyssey. The typography is impeccable and the layouts all have great tension throughout. The kicker is the glow-in-the-dark ink elegantly applied in key areas that hurdle it past mere gimmickry. The black and white renderings of planets and black holes and other weird space stuff are awesome to look at. If there is life in other planets they are all checking this project on Behance. See full project
